result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keith D. Hartje

records.addlTxt: Bond Receipt from Rock County Sheriff Office
Bail bond faxed to Rock County Jail for signature
Warrant canceled with T.K. at dispatch at 1:41 p.m.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

12:56 PM/Room 203. Defendant Keith D. Hartje appeared by video, in custody at Rock County Jail.  Attorney Philip J. Brehm in court for Keith D. Hartje.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All appearances are by Zoom.  Initial appearance already held but did not have counsel at that time.  Attny Brehm is okay with waiving time limits for P.H., asks that warrant be quashed.  Court quashes warrant. Court indicates time limits for P.H. have been waived. State heard on bond, original $750 bond was put in forfeiture status, requests $5,000 signature bond with maintain absolute sobriety, Banned from Class B liquor license establishments and No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. Asks that bond forfeiture hearing be removed from calendar and track this case.  The Court orders $3,000 signature bond with conditions no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.  Bail bond forfeiture hearing to be removed from calendar and track with case. Attny Brehm may appear at next hearing by Zoom. Bail bond to be sent to Rock County for signature.
Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Return on warrant on August 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return on warrant on August 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 028432,
Payable Number: 66773,
Receipt Number: 22R 003313,
Amount: $20.00
Bond posted in Rock County, per Langlade County Jail.

2:19 PM Defendant Keith D. Hartje not in court.  Attorney Elizabeth Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court hears from State on recommendations. Requests warrant body only, Nation wide. Court agrees with State. State moves to forfeit cash bond. Court orders

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.

1:06 PM Defendant Keith D. Hartje appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via video. Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. wants an attorney and direct to contact PD. Victim rights complied. Def. is on probation hold. State gives bail/bond recommendation, Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances &  No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. Def. heard on bail/bond.  Response by State. Court gives 3 factors for setting bond & orders $750 cash  with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety, No illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription& No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
